events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle that occurred on a busy intersection, initiating the claim process.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and accident details provided by the claimant.
An agent specialized in vehicle accidents was assigned to the claim to ensure a prompt and thorough investigation.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed to the customer that the process has started.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and repair estimates for claim verification.
The claimant submitted all required documents including police reports and mechanic assessments for the damaged vehicle.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted documents and arranging for a physical inspection of the vehicle.
Investigation concluded confirming the extent of damage matches the reported collision, with no discrepancies found.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount based on repair costs and policy terms, sent for customer review.
Customer responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and willingness to proceed with the offer.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance underwriter after all conditions were met successfully.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued and transferred to the customer's designated account promptly.
The claim file was closed after payment confirmation and final communication was sent to the claimant.
